text: Who would expect to see Surfers Hanging Ten (almost) in the middle of a Park in Munich Germany. Well... That is exactly what you will see if you visit the Eisbach where it enters the Englischer Garten not far from Marianplatz in Downtown Munich... This is a nice side visit while you are in Munich... With all of the attractions and Food options that this city offers... No wonder we visit Munich on an almost yearly basis!!!

title: Inland River Surfing
text: As a Floridian, I had to see this, surfing inland in a mountainous region.  However hydrologic forces of water to source the English Garden create a rapid wave that can be surfed.  My son has friend who surfed it about two weeks before we got there.  While the physics of a shore wave and a rapid wave are different, you can surf it.  Our friend says its cold and it is more difficult to keep forward momentum in a rapid.  Still he overcame and enjoyed.  We simply enjoyed watching surfers take turns with many wiping out but some holding their own.  It really is something you need to visit to see.  Unfortunately the main bridge to watch from is currently under construction, so watch from the river banks as we did.

title: Not always as tame as shown in this photo
text: There is a surfing culture surrounding this Englisher Garden landmark, and a strict protocol followed by the surfers {for the sake of safety, as missing the eddy on river right could result in a swim into a hydropower plant downstream}.   I did not see any kayaks here, and I'm not sure how the level of cooperation that I witnessed was achieved.

text: It's not Bells Beach, and you don't have to chase the waves or lie on your board waiting for a big one, but you do need a wet suit!!
